intro: Polyschemone nivalis, commonly known as the snow polychaete, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in cold, mountainous environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Polyschemone nivalis plays a role in the alpine ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization.
